qas.question: The Times was the first newspaper to send correspondents to what kind of event?
Who was The Times first correspondent with an army?
Which war did The Times first cover using correspondents?

context: The Times was the first newspaper to send <a0_0>war<a0_0/> correspondents to cover particular conflicts. <a1_0>W. H. Russell<a1_0/>, the paper's correspondent with the army in the <a2_0>Crimean War<a2_0/>, was immensely influential with his dispatches back to England.
